orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards to move the tower from left to right while respecting Tower of Hanoi constraints.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi instance with three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are four disks labeled A B C D from smallest (A) to largest (D).
Initially left peg has disks top-to-bottom A B C D. Middle and right pegs are empty.
The goal is to move the entire stack so right peg has top-to-bottom A B C D and left and middle pegs are empty.
Moves must move exactly one disk at a time.
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL modeling and the FastDownwards planner. Using the reports from the peg agents, produce a complete PDDL domain and a complete PDDL problem file that encode the Tower of Hanoi instance for FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Make sure the domain encodes single-disk moves, the constraint that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk, and predicates for disk sizes and disk locations. The problem must define objects, initial state, and goal state corresponding to the instance. Keep actions for different pegs distinct if relevant.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information} You will receive reports from the three peg agents: {left_report} {middle_report} {right_report} Your goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Integrate the peg reports, resolve any naming differences, and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting FastDownwards.
